TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {12806=Date: Saturday 17 August 2013 Kick-off: 3:00pm, 6513=Fulham began the 2013/14 Barclays Premier League season with a fine 1-0 win away at Sunderland after a goal from Pajtim Kasami.}
textBeforeTable: As It Stood Table Manager: Martin Jol Unused substitutes: Senderos, Ruiz, Rodallega, Bent Line-up: Stekelenburg (Stockdale 76'); Riether, Hughes, Hangeland, Richardson (Briggs 20'); Duff, Derek Boateng (Karagounis 65'), Sidwell, Taarabt; Kasami; Berbatov Fulham Manager: Paolo Di Canio Unused substitutes: Mannone, Diakité, Cuéllar, Ba, Moberg-Karlsson Line-up: Westwood; Celustka (Wickham 86'), O'Shea, Roberge, Colback; Adam Johnson, Cabral, Larsson, Giaccherini; Sessegnon (Ji 72'); Jozy Altidore Sunderland Referee: Neil Swarbrick Venue: Stadium of Light, Sunderland Attendance: 43,905 Date: Saturday 17 August 2013 Kick-off: 3:00pm Competition: Barclays Premier League Match Information Duff went into the book for a cynical foul in the final seconds, but after five long minutes of injury time the points were ours. Paolo Di Canio threw Conor Wickham on to give Sunderland more attacking options and Altidore burst through two tackles into the box but his weak shot was gathered easily by Stockdale. Defending bravely, Fulham put men behind the ball in an effort to defend the lead as the game entered the final five minutes and Ji’s header flashed just wide to sighs of relief from the away support.
